author: ghost
body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

Import-Module may fail based on the current set of "using namespace" in use. I have the ```Windows.Win32.Foundation.BOOLEAN``` in scope via CsWin32 and ```using namespace Windows.Win32.Foundation```, which then conflicts with ```System.Boolean``` when I try to import a variety of modules (e.g. NetSecurity).

### Expected behavior

```console
# Enter these one by one at command line as .ps1 can't have "using namespace" anywhere but the beginning

using namespace System
Import-Module NetSecurity -Force

# This should work
Add-Type "namespace Windows.Win32.Foundation { public struct BOOLEAN {} }"
using namespace Windows.Win32.Foundation
Import-Module NetSecurity -Force
```


### Actual behavior

```console
# Enter these one by one at command line as .ps1 can't have "using namespace" anywhere but the beginning

using namespace System
Import-Module NetSecurity -Force

# This doesn't work
Add-Type "namespace Windows.Win32.Foundation { public struct BOOLEAN {} }"
using namespace Windows.Win32.Foundation
Import-Module NetSecurity -Force
```


### Error details

```console
Import-Module: Cannot process Cmdlet Definition XML for the following file:
C:\Windows\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\Modules\NetSecurity\NetFirewallRule.cmdletDefinition.cdxml.
Type name 'boolean' is ambiguous, it could be 'System.Boolean' or 'Windows.Win32.Foundation.BOOLEAN'.
```


### Environment data

```powershell
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.2.4
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.2.4
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.22000
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```


### Visuals

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4591158/169587227-75669ebd-b380-482e-96fc-223c915bdae8.png)

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: I think this is more of an issue with the module `NetSecurity`, which uses the partial type name `boolean`. The `System` namespace will be tried out by default in PowerShell, and that's why running `Import-Module NetSecurity` will work. But once you introduce a new namespace which contains another `Boolean` definition, the type name `boolean` itself becomes ambiguous and hence the error message.

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as external and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been be closed for housekeeping purposes.

title: Import-Module may fail based on "using namespace"
